sub_title: I am interested in pursuing careers that involve research, safety, international relations, and cyber-related fields.
summary:
As I embark on my career journey, I find myself passionately seeking an intriguing research or analytical position that transcends borders and encompasses a global perspective.   I am open for offers as from right now.

I am a Crisis Management,International Relations, and Political Science graduate from the Universities of Bristol, Leicester and Leiden. Currently, I work as a Senior Policy Maker in Security for the Directorate of Innovation at the Economics Ministry of the Netherlands Government. Additionally, I serve as a director and trainer for a global non-governmental organization.

I possess exceptional skills in thinking out of the box, working efficiently within fast-paced and global environments, and I have a strong focus on finding practical solutions. 

Throughout my life, studies, and professional experiences, I have gained valuable international exposure. I derive great satisfaction from analysing data and information to generate meaningful and insightful conclusions. My areas of particular interest include security, internationalisation, and cyber-related matters.

I am fluent in English, German, and Dutch, and hold permanent residency status in the U.K and Netherlands.

education.field_of_study: Crisis and Security Management: Intelligence and National Security
Political Science and International Relations with minor in Journalism (Joint Honours)

awards.title: Council of Gouda - Honours Citation
awards.description: At the age of eighteen, I was honoured with a citation for my efforts in establishing community projects in my local area. These initiatives served as a positive example in reducing crime rates within my local council and promoting inclusivity throughout society.

profile_positions.description:
In 2022, I established my second NGO  with a specific focus on enhancing understanding of cyberspace, photonics, and nanotechnology among diverse audiences. At present, I am actively involved in designing projects that aim to raise awareness among policymakers, universities, and young individuals about the broader issues surrounding these domains, working accros the globe.

One of my key objectives is to develop training courses that effectively disseminate knowledge and equip participants with the necessary tools to mitigate the effects associated with these fields. By doing so, I strive to contribute to a more informed and responsible use.
profile_positions.title: Director

company.name: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description:
In my last position, my primary responsibility involved conducting analyses on contemporary threats faced by knowledge and research institutions. I then translated these analyses into actionable recommendations for implementation. Additionally, I provided support to both the bilateral international policy team and the knowledge infrastructure team. This support entailed conducting data analysis using tools like Excel and assisting in the planning of approaches and roadmaps to various initiatives like building up an international innovation strategy and allowances for infrastructure development. 

During my tenure, I had the opportunity to participate in a program focused on making policy recommendations to the diversity and inclusion team. This experience not only allowed me to contribute to important initiatives but also provided a platform for learning about innovative approaches that can be applied within civil service.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor Economic Security & STI - Directorate-General for Enterprise and Innovation

profile_positions.description:
Six years ago, I founded my own NGO with the aim of sharing my expertise on societal issues and creating a platform that bridges the gap between theory and practice. In this role, I take on multiple responsibilities. I serve as a project manager, designing programs from scratch and securing funding for long-term projects. These initiatives are focused on making meaningful contributions in areas such as diversity, citizenship, sustainability, and security.

Additionally, I actively engage in research to better understand the problems at hand. This research allows me to develop effective policy solutions that can be implemented by various stakeholders, including NGOs, governments, and local foundations. My work extends beyond national borders, as I strive to address these issues on a European Union-wide scale.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: In my role, I was responsible for preparing advice notes, communication plans, and project plans pertaining to two subsidy lines focused on combatting child labor and unfair mining practices. Additionally, I played a key role in disseminating our findings through various online formats and conducted comprehensive transcriptions and analysis of conversations to gain deeper insights.
profile_positions.title: Project Advisor: International Development

volunteer_experiences.description: As a volunteer for Nuffic, a government set up but independent organisation that promotes study opportunities abroad for Dutch students, I have served as an ambassador. In this role, I directly engage with prospective students at schools, aiming to generate their interest in studying abroad. I share my personal experiences and highlighted the benefits I have personally gained from an international education.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member Working Group European and Sustainable Affairs.
volunteer_experiences.description:
NJR, which stands for the Dutch Youth Council, is a collaborative platform comprising influential youth and democracy organizations. Within this organization, I have actively participated as a member of two working groups: one focused on European Affairs and the other on Climate Action.

In these working groups, I have taken the initiative to design, plan, and execute various projects and small-scale actions aimed at fostering broader engagement on these topics. Additionally, I organized a series of events held at Permanent EU representations and schools, actively involving young people and encouraging their active participation in these fields.

Furthermore, I had the opportunity to contribute to policy development by co-writing policy recommendations that have been incorporated in COP13, thereby influencing climate-related discussions at an international level.

In my role as a tutor, I have served as a reliable support person  for three international students, acting as their primary point of contact. I have provided personalized study advice and guidance to help them navigate their academic journey. Additionally, I have facilitated their integration into the wider Leicester community by connecting them with various opportunities available in the area.

volunteer_experiences.role: Talent at AMS project IV Alfred Mozer
volunteer_experiences.description:
As part of the AMS Talent Programme, I had the opportunity to conduct in-depth interviews with diplomats, focusing on the topic of Middle East rivalry. Furthermore, I visited various embassies in The Hague to engage in insightful discussions with ambassadors.

Additionally, I played a pivotal role in creating a comprehensive political analysis specifically tailored for the NL Labour party. This involved conducting extensive research and providing strategic insights to support their political agenda. Moreover, I took the lead in facilitating panel conversations, fostering meaningful dialogue among experts and stakeholders.
